verses.text: 那時有成千上萬的人聚在一起，甚至彼此踐踏。耶穌就先對門徒說：「你們要提防法利賽人的酵，就是虛偽。

words.note: Lit. 'form thousands, exceed ten thousands'.
Lit. 'door follower'.

verses.heading: Fear God, Not People

verses.text: 沒有甚麼掩蓋的事不被揭露，也沒有甚麼隱藏的事不被人知道。
所以，你們在暗處所說的，必在明處被人聽見；在內室附耳所談的，必在房頂上宣揚出來。

words.note: Refers to a private place, often for prayer in a biblical context.
A vivid expression for speaking quietly, into one's ear.
Rooftops in ancient times were public spaces for announcements.

verses.text: 「我的朋友，我告訴你們，那殺身體以後不能再作甚麼的，不要怕他們。
我要指示你們當怕的是誰：當怕那殺身體以後，有權把人投入地獄裡的；我告訴你們，應當怕他。
五隻麻雀，不是賣兩個大錢嗎？但在 神面前，一隻也不被忘記。

words.note: The preceding space is a traditional mark of reverence.

verses.text: 甚至你們的頭髮都一一數過了。不要怕，你們比許多麻雀貴重得多呢。
「我告訴你們，凡在人面前承認我的，人子在 神的使者面前也承認他；

words.note: Indicates 'the one who...'
A title for Jesus in the Gospels.
The preceding space is a traditional mark of reverence.

verses.text: 在人面前不認我的，我在 神的使者面前也不認他。

words.note: Here implies 'to deny' when coupled with 不 (bù).
Indicates 'the one who...'
The preceding space is a traditional mark of reverence.
Here implies 'to deny' when coupled with 不 (bù).

verses.text: 凡說話得罪人子的，還可以赦免；但褻瀆聖靈的，必不得赦免。

words.note: A title for Jesus in the Gospels.
Indicates 'the one who...'
Indicates 'the one who...'
In this context, means 'cannot' or 'will not receive'.

verses.text: 人把你們拉到會堂、官長和當權者的面前，你們不要思慮怎樣申辯或說甚麼話。
到了時候，聖靈必把當說的話教導你們。」

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 群眾中有一個人對耶穌說：「老師，請吩咐我的兄弟和我分家業。」

words.note: Common in biblical and formal contexts.
Refers to property/estate inherited from family.

verses.heading: The Parable of the Rich Landowner

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你這個人，誰立我作你們的審判官和分家業的人呢？」

words.note: Can be an address of mild rebuke or emphasis.

verses.text: 於是他對眾人說：「你們要謹慎，遠離一切貪心，因為人的生命並不在於家道豐富。」

words.note: Lit. 'greedy heart'.
Used to emphasize negation.

verses.text: 就對他們講了一個比喻，說：「有一個富翁的田地豐收。

words.note: A story used to illustrate a moral or spiritual lesson.

verses.text: 他自己心裡說：『怎麼辦呢？因為我沒有足夠的地方收藏出產了！』
又說：『我要這樣辦：我要拆掉這些倉房，建造更大的，好在那裡收藏我的一切糧食和貨物。
然後，我要對我的靈魂說：靈魂啊，你擁有許多好東西，足夠多年享用，只管安安逸逸地吃喝快樂吧！』

words.note: Derived from 'east and west', referring to general things.
Reduplication of 安逸 (ān yì) for emphasis.

verses.text: 神卻對他說：『無知的人哪，今天晚上，你的靈魂必被取去，你所預備的要歸給誰呢？』

words.note: Indicates the object or result of the verb.

verses.text: 凡為自己積財，在 神面前卻不富足的，也是這樣。」

words.note: Verb-object compound, specifically referring to material wealth accumulation.
Refers to being spiritually rich, not just materially.

verses.text: ，積財於天耶穌又對門徒說：「所以我告訴你們，不要為生命憂慮吃甚麼，也不要為身體憂慮穿甚麼。

words.note: Verb-object compound, specifically referring to material wealth accumulation.
Classical Chinese preposition, meaning 'in' or 'at'.
Often means 'heaven' in religious context, 'sky' otherwise.
Verb-object compound, 'to tell'.
Alternative form: 什麼.
Alternative form: 什麼.

verses.heading: Exhortation Not to Worry

verses.text: 因為生命比飲食重要，身體比衣服重要。
你們想想烏鴉：牠們不種也不收，無倉又無庫， 神尚且養活牠們；你們比飛鳥貴重得多了。

words.note: Reduplication of verb indicates a casual or brief action.
Literary equivalent of 沒有 (méiyǒu).
Literary equivalent of 沒有 (méiyǒu).
Used to emphasize 'even then' or 'still'.
Verb-complement compound, meaning 'to feed and keep alive'.
Connects verb/adjective to a complement describing degree or result.
Indicates a significant degree, 'much more'.

verses.text: 你們中間誰能用憂慮使自己的壽命延長一刻呢？

words.note: Originally a quarter hour, now often means 'a moment'.

verses.text: 既然連這極小的事都不能作，為甚麼還憂慮其他的事呢？
你們想想百合花，怎樣不勞苦，也不紡織。但我告訴你們，就是所羅門最榮華的時候所穿的，也比不上這花中的一朵呢。

words.note: Reduplication of verbs often softens the tone or implies a casual action.
Lit. 'hundred-joined flower', referring to the scales of a lily bulb.
Refers to a state of magnificent glory or prosperity.
Used to form a nominalized phrase, often implying 'that which is...'

verses.text: 小信的人哪，田野的草，今天還在，明天就投進爐裡， 神尚且這樣給它裝飾，何況你們呢？

words.note: A common epithet for disciples in the Gospels, indicating insufficient faith.
Literary and formal, often used in rhetorical questions.

verses.text: 你們不要求吃甚麼，喝甚麼，也不要憂慮，

words.note: A verb-object compound, meaning 'to ask for food' or 'to seek to eat'.

verses.text: 因為這一切都是世上不信的人所尋求的。你們的父原知道你們需要這一切。

words.note: Used to form a nominalized phrase, often implying 'that which is...'
Often refers to God the Father in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 你們只管求他的國，這些東西都必加給你們。

words.note: Lit. 'only mind', meaning 'just do it without hesitation'.
Refers to God; often capitalized in English Bible translations for deity.
In this context, refers to the 'Kingdom of God'.
Etymology: originally referred to commodities from East and West.

verses.text: 你們這小群，不要怕，因為你們的父樂意把國賜給你們。

words.note: Biblical metaphor for a small group of believers.
In this context, refers to God the Father.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
Refers to the 'Kingdom of God'.
More formal than 給, often used for gifts from a superior.

verses.text: 當變賣你們所有的施捨給人，為自己製造不朽壞的錢囊，積蓄用不盡的財寶在天上，就是賊不能近、蟲不能蛀的地方。

words.note: Often used in religious or philanthropic contexts.
A key theological concept relating to eternal life.
Refers to a traditional purse, less common than modern 包 (bāo).
Lit. 'use not exhaust'.
Often used for spiritual or valuable possessions in a moral sense.
Lit. 'in the sky', but here referring to heaven as God's abode.
Often seen in 蛀蟲 (woodworm).

verses.text: 因為你們的財寶在哪裡，你們的心也在哪裡。

words.note: Often used for spiritual or valuable possessions in a moral sense.

verses.text: 「你們的腰當束起來，燈也該點著，

words.note: Refers to tucking up long robes for readiness.

verses.heading: Call to Faithful Stewardship

verses.text: 像等候自己的主人從婚筵回來一樣，好叫你們在主人回來敲門時，立刻給他開門。

words.note: Refers to a master of servants or a lord.
Often follows a clause to indicate 'when...'

verses.text: 主人來到了，看見僕人警醒，這些僕人就有福了。我實在告訴你們，主人必親自束腰，招待他們吃飯，進前來侍候他們。

words.note: Used in biblical contexts for 'servant' or 'slave'.
Often used in a spiritual sense of being watchful.
Common biblical term for 'blessed'.
Ancient practice of tying up loose garments for activity/service.
Often used with '來' (進前來) meaning 'come forward'.
Used as a directional complement here.

verses.text: 主人也許半夜之前，或天亮之前回來，看見他們這樣，這些僕人就有福了。
你們都知道，家主若曉得竊賊甚麼時候來，就不會讓他摸進屋裡。

words.note: Specifically refers to the master of a house or family.
More formal or literary than 知道.
Implies entering stealthily or by feel.

verses.text: 你們也要準備妥當，因為在想不到的時候，人子就來了。」

words.note: Lit. 'think not arrive/reach', meaning 'cannot imagine' or 'unexpected'.
A title Jesus used for himself in the Gospels.

verses.text: 彼得說：「主啊，你說這比喻，是為我們還是為眾人呢？」

words.note: Refers to Jesus, hence a proper noun.

verses.text: 主說：「誰是那忠心精明的管家，被主人指派管理家裡的僕人，按時分糧呢？

words.note: Refers to Jesus, hence a proper noun.
Refers to a household manager in ancient times.
Specific duty of a steward.

verses.text: 主人來到的時候，看見他這樣作，那僕人就有福了。
我實在告訴你們，主人要指派他管理主人的一切財產。
如果那僕人心裡說：『我的主人不會那麼快回來』，就動手打其他的僕人使女，並且吃喝醉酒；

words.definition: to lay hands on, to start
words.note: Lit. 'move hands', implies taking action or physically harming.
Refers to a female servant, often found in historical/biblical texts.

verses.text: 在他想不到的日子、不知道的時間，那僕人的主人要來，嚴厲地處罰他，使他和不信的人同在一起。

words.note: Lit. 'unable to think of/imagine'

verses.text: 那僕人知道主人的意思，卻不預備，也不照他的意思行，必多受責打；
但那不知道的，雖然作了該受責打的事，也必少受責打。多給誰就向誰多取，多託誰就向誰多要。
「我來要把火投在地上，如果燒了起來，那是我所願意的。

words.definition: on the earth, on the ground

words.note: Resultative complement indicating onset of an action.
Indicates the object of the following verb.

verses.heading: Not Peace, but Division

verses.text: 我有應當受的洗，我是多麼迫切地期待這事完成。

words.note: Short for 洗禮 (xǐlǐ), meaning baptism.

verses.text: 你們以為我來是要地上有和平嗎？不是的，我告訴你們，是要有紛爭。
從今以後，一家五口將起紛爭，三個反對兩個，兩個反對三個。

words.note: Lit. 'five mouths,' meaning five family members.

verses.text: 他們將起紛爭：父親反對兒子，兒子反對父親，母親反對女兒，女兒反對母親，婆婆反對媳婦，媳婦反對婆婆。」
耶穌又對眾人說：「你們一看見西邊有雲彩升起來，就說：『要下大雨』，果然這樣；
verses.heading: Reading the Signs

verses.text: 起了南風，就說：『天要熱了』，也果然這樣。
偽君子啊！你們知道分辨天地的氣象，怎麼不知道分辨這個時代呢？

words.note: Literally 'false gentleman', implying pretense of virtue.

verses.text: 「你們為甚麼自己不能判斷甚麼是對的呢？

words.note: Here nominalizes '對' (right) into 'that which is right'.

verses.heading: Clear the Debts

verses.text: 你和你的對頭去見官長，還在路上的時候，應當盡力向他求和，免得他把你拉到法官面前，法官把你交給差役，差役把你關在監裡。

words.note: Refers to a governing official, often a judge.

words.definition: on the way, on the road

words.note: A common phrase in biblical contexts for seeking peace or agreement.
Indicates direct object is placed before verb.
Refers to a subordinate officer or messenger of a court.

verses.text: 我告訴你，除非你還清最後的一個小錢，否則決不能從那裡出來。」

words.note: Refers to a very small monetary unit, like a penny or mite in English.
